title: Luke Perry's daughter Sophie shares birthday tribute to Riverdale star
text:
‘Happy birthday, fashion icon’ (Picture: Sophie Perry/Instagram)

Luke Perry’s daughter Sophie has penned a sweet message to her late dad on what would have been his 53rd birthday.

The 19-year-old shared a snap of herself and her father grinning contentedly as they clung onto each other.

The Riverdale star donned a navy suit jacket and plaid shorts, which Sophie joked about in the sweet post.

‘Happy birthday, fashion icon,’ she wrote. ‘I can hear you doing your best Tim Gunn impersonation now [heart emoji]. Love you the most.’

Fans and friends of the late star were quick to share supportive messages, with David Arquette commenting three heart emojis.

Riverdale’s Madelaine Petsch (Cheryl Blossom) added: ‘Love this,’ with co-star Skeet Ulrich (FP Jones) also sending her heart emojis.

Luke, who also starred in 90210, tragically died back in March after suffering a stroke.

A statement confirming the news, explained that he had been surrounded by his family and close friends.

‘Actor Luke Perry, 52, passed away today after suffering a massive stroke,’ the statement read. ‘He was surrounded by his children Jack and Sophie, fiancé Wendy Madison Bauer, ex-wife Rachel ‘Minnie’ Sharp, mother Ann Bennett, step-father Steve Bennett, brother Tom Perry, sister Amy Coder, and other close family and friends.’

Meanwhile, Riverdale recently said a heartbreaking farewell to him with the death of his character Fred Andrews.

In the season four premiere titled In Memoriam, Riverdale opened the episode with Fred’s son Archie (KJ Apa) receiving a phone call from police inside Pop’s Diner, before he drops his phone and falls to his knees.

Back in his home, FP tells Archie and his mother how Fred decided to stop and help a motorist on the side of the road on his way home, only for him to be killed in a hit and run while assisting the stranger.

The episode saw characters reminisce about Fred’s influence on their early years, before Archie goes to the site of the hit and run where they find his dad’s truck.

Luke played Fred Andrews on the show (Picture: CW)

A funeral for Fred takes place later in the episode, seeing characters Archie, Jughead (Cole Sprouse), Kevin (Casey Cott), and more carry his casket, while a moving rendition of Amazing Grace plays out.

A number of characters, including Betty (Lili Reinhart), place roses on the casket in the emotional scene, as the camera cuts back to a photo of Luke’s character sitting on top.

Multiple members of the cast and crew shared tributes to their friend, with the show’s creator Roberto Aguirre Sacasa writing: ‘Tonight Season 4 of #Riverdale premieres. With an episode that honors our friend Luke.

‘It’s an episode bursting with sadness, but even more so with love. I’m humbled by the outstanding work everyone did on it. I hope you like it, Luke. We miss you every day.’
